content:
Bed linen and sheets must comply with JYSK 4004.

Baby/Child/Junior (hereafter children) bed linen must comply with EN 16779-2 and below requirements and requirements in 5.

The supplier must send a reference sample to JYSK HO and await approval from JYSK before initiating first production.

Reference sample must:

• Contain 1 pillowcase and 1 duvet cover.

• The size of reference sample must comply with the size requirements of Table 1 – Photo sample requirementsTable 1 regardless the size(s) of the actual product.

• Comply with any agreed specifications.

• Zippers must be in matching color to the cover (see 3.3).

Note: Strike-off or lab dip can be received for design or color approval before sending the reference sample. The reference sample may be a strike-off or lab dip.

The supplier must send three a shipment sample to JYSK HO and await approval from JYSK before shipping first-

Note: If a shipment sample is approved it will may be regarded as and saved as the new reference sample.

Suppliers must send photo samples to JYSK HO as soon as possible after reference samples are approved by CAM.

Note: remember ‘attn:’ to CAM.

The size of photo samples must comply with the size requirements of Table 1 regardless the size(s) of the actual product.

For bed linen sets the supplier must send complete sets for each type of set represented

For all new products supplier must send 1 kolli space samples. The sample must be SGL size for bed linen, and 90x200xxx cm for sheets.

For paper materials used in sales-unit packaging, suppliers must send a material sample with a matching technical specification to CAM and await approval before first use.

Care labels must comply with JYSK 4004 and JYSK 6004.

Care label material must be taffeta or polyester satin according to agreement with CAM.

Placement of care label must comply Table 2.

| Product type   | Placement                                                                                      | Unnamed: 2                       |

| Duvet covers   | The care label must be placed inside the cover in the left side seam (relative to opening end. | opening) 10+3 cm from the        |
| Pillowcases    | The care label must be placed inside the cover in the left side seam (relative to end.         | opening) 5+2 cm from the opening |
| Sheets         | The care label must be placed in the left side seam underneath the sheet 1043 cm               | from the (foot-) end.            |

Seams must comply with below requirements:

• Seams and stitches must run evenly.

• Seams must not pucker.

• The supplier must ensure correct adjustment of sewing machines to prevent slack and tight stitches.

• Seams must be properly secured with minimum

content:
‘EA’ measures are the same as ‘store shelf dimensions’ in the PIF. The ‘store shelf dimensions (EA)’ is a unit measure of a single article. If changes in the measurements of an article, CAM must be informed.

Articles in sales display (SDP) must comply with JYSK 6002 and any specific article requirements. For articles in SDP both the SDP measure and the EA measure must be stated in the PIF. The SDP measure must include both the article and the SDP, meaning if the article is higher than the display it must be the total height.

It is important to know how the article should be displayed e.g. upright, laying down, etc.

The following measurements must be stated in the PIF:

• Height: the height of the article.

• Width: the width of the article (the side facing front).

• Depth: the depth of the article and refers to the shelf depth and means the article dimension with face forward.

Note: Depth = length

Examples of measurements of different products and shapes Figure 1.

Note: The examples are only to provide an understanding of how to measure different articles and shapes, and not a full guide to all types of articles.

Sheet rolled packed:

All products delivered must match the approved reference samples. Differences between purchasing orders is not accepted.

Pantone colors must be matched.

Color variation between for example pillowcase and duvet cover are not allowed.

content:
Pillowcases must be closed with zipper in accordance with 3.3 except the following:

• Regular pillowcases sold separately must be closed with a 20 cm inner flap (hotel closing) on the right side, unless otherwise specified by CAM.

• Flannel pillowcases must be closed with a 20 cm inner flap (hotel closing) in the bottom.

Zipper closing on pillowcases must:

• Be in the center of the bottom of the pillowcase.

• Have a length 10 cm shorter than the pillowcase width.

For remnant pillowcases seasonal designs (e.g. Christmas designs) or branded designs must not be used.

Zippers must:

• Be in matching color to the cover.

• Comply with any agreed specifications (e.g. brand or performance standard).

• Zipper openings must contain suitably strong double stitch stops in both ends.

• Duvet cover sets (except flannel) must be with YKK zipper and bought directly at YKK’S local offices. Remember to use JYSK buying code: 100922.

• The supplier must ensure that zipper and slider match each other and run smoothly.

• The slider must be without puller.

• The zipper must exceed the stop by 15 – 20 mm.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

• BASIC quality products must contain a slightly covered zipper without flap.

Buttons must:

• Be in matching color to the cover or transparent.

• Comply with any agreed specifications (e.g. brand or performance standard).

• Be fastened sufficiently to not fall off when subjected to normal and foreseeable use.

• Be hidden when closed, see below example.

content:
When the solution is available the layout for sales unit packaging is created by JYSK using IDG and forwarded to the supplier.

When IDG is not available, suppliers must create the artwork layout in accordance with JYSK 6201. The supplier must proofread the artwork, validate the layout and ensure that all stated information is correct – E.g.: Closing method symbol for covers, material composition, care symbols, OEKO-TEX logo, barcode, batch number, supplier number and product number.

For new artwork supplier must send proofread and validated artwork to CAM via email and await response before first

printing.

Note: JYSK does not proofread or approve the artwork – The review procedure of new artwork is however in place out of common interest of ensuring the artwork is correct.

Products packaged as sales units without plastic bag must be folded in accordance with 4.4 or rolled in accordance with 4.5.

The folding method for products without plastic bag must not include display of double facing. Note: Indication of double facing is shown the bellyband illustrations.

The folded or rolled product must be enclosed by a paper bellyband with a height of:

• 150±1 mm for bed linen sets, folded sheets and rolled products.

• 120±1 mm for Single pillowcases.

For folded products the length of bellyband ‘sides’ must be adapted to the actual product.

The bellyband closure must have an overlap ≥30 mm.

Bellyband material must
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: comply with sales packaging requirements according to JYSK 6001. Stiffener must be JYSK CB40 according to JYSK 6001.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content:
The closing method of the bellyband must be double-sided adhesive tape and strengthened with a transparent round sticker.

The sticker must be neatly placed (centered) on the bellyband closing edge.

Bed linen and sheets packaged with plastic bag must be folded in accordance with 4.4 around a stiffener and placed in a plastic bag with a paper insert.

The plastic bag must be fitted to the size of the product and with easy closing - i.e. No tape must be used.

The closure of the bag must be in the top and warning symbol (JYSK 60005) must be printed on the flap so it is placed over the “empty”/colored space on the back of the layout.

The quality of the plastic bag must be:

• 70 my (0,070mm) clear polypropylene for BASIC and PLUS products.

• 100 my (0,10mm) LDPE for GOLD products.

Warnings on the plastic bag must comply with JYSK 6101.

A bag sample and a matching technical specification must be sent to CAM for approval before first use.

The cardboard stiffener must be JYSK CB40 according to JYSK 6001.

Suppliers must use the above directions when folding and cutting inserts for duvet cover sets and sheets.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

• The cardboard of the cardboard box must be JYSK CB60 according to JYSK 6001.

content:
Bed linen for children must be produced and labelled according to EN 16779-2 and below sections. Few requirements from EN 16779-2 are listed in this chapter however the supplier must ensure conformity with the entire standard hereunder stricter demands for tread, sewing and seams for children bed linen. Plastic- or rubber print, applications etc. on the duvet cover is not allowed. Loop labels, sharp edges, pockets or other loose parts in the duvet cover is not allowed.

For all children's bedding, supplier must send a sample with packaging for approval as soon as the layout has been received and the master sample has been approved.

Seams for children products must comply with 1.3 and below:

• Chain stitches are not allowed.

Sewing thread for children products must comply with 1.4 and below:

• Monofilament threads not allowed.

• Maximum length for cut treads shall be 10 mm.

Zippers must comply with EN 16779-2 and below:

• Be in matching color to the cover.

• Comply with any agreed specifications (e.g. brand or performance standard).

• Duvet cover sets (except flannel) must be with YKK zipper and bought directly at YKK’S local offices. • Remember to use JYSK buying code: 100922.

• Puller item no.: 8034285. Item description: 03 C DA16Q EJ PARTS KENSIN N-ANTI TWIST4.

• Zipper item no.: 3599627. Item description: 03 CF CHAIN PB12 DYED

Note: Use both item no. and item decripion ordering the zippers to be sure to get the correct items from YKK

• The zipper must exceed the stop by 15 – 20 mm.

• Zipper openings must contain suitably strong tripple stitch stops in both ends.

Note: The thread must not be red, as in Figure 17. This is only to make it more visible on the foto.

• Alternatively a “fixed zipper” can be used

• Item description: CFC-36 DA16Q EJ PB12 GREEN-F KENSIN N-ANTI TB-IPOM TWIST4

• Be made with a flap of 3 cm to cover the zipper

content: ‘EA’ measures are the same as ‘store shelf dimensions’ in the PIF. The ‘store shelf dimensions (EA)’ is a unit measure of a single article. If changes in the measurements of an article, CAM must be informed.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: Articles in sales display (SDP) must comply with JYSK 6002 and any specific article requirements. For articles in SDP both the SDP measure and the EA measure must be stated in the PIF. The SDP measure must include both the article and the SDP, meaning if the article is higher than the display it must be the total height.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: It is important to know how the article should be displayed e.g. upright, laying down, etc.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: The following measurements must be stated in the PIF:
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: • Height: the height of the article.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: • Width: the width of the article (the side facing front).
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: • Depth: the depth of the article and refers to the shelf depth and means the article dimension with face forward.

content: 4.1 Procedures for artwork
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: When the solution is available the layout for sales unit packaging is created by JYSK using IDG and forwarded to the supplier.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: When IDG is not available, suppliers must create the artwork layout in accordance with JYSK 6201. The supplier must proofread the artwork, validate the layout and ensure that all stated information is correct – E.g.: Closing method symbol for covers, material composition, care symbols, OEKO-TEX logo, barcode, batch number, supplier number and product number.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: For new artwork supplier must send proofread and validated artwork to CAM via email and await response before first
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: Note: JYSK does not proofread or approve the artwork – The review procedure of new artwork is however in place out of common interest of ensuring the artwork is correct.
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: 5 Bed linen for children
source: JYSK 1001 - Category standard - Bed linen and sheets.pdf

content: Bed linen for children must be produced and labelled according to EN 16779-2 and below sections. Few requirements from EN 16779-2 are listed in this chapter however the supplier must ensure conformity with the entire standard hereunder stricter demands for tread, sewing and seams for children bed linen. Plastic- or rubber print, applications etc. on the duvet cover is not allowed. Loop labels, sharp edges, pockets or other loose parts in the duvet cover is not allowed.
